page.title: 12 YOUTH ACTIVITIES
page.content: The scouts were formed in England by Lord Baden-Powell for boys to set a good example to the human race,respect the countryside,influence their instincts to out-door life and to develop a good character.Part of this training is to wear a uniform. These boys have weekly meetings in their hut which is usually borrowed. Scout groups are divided into patrols with different names,tending to be of animals but their is only one flag representing their town or village. The scouts are accustomed to singing together in the evenings to boost their morale.This is commonly done when the scouts go camping in tents at week-ends.The scouts usually have out-door games to get accustomed to the countryside and to get to know their surroundings and how to survive.
